statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
Given an N * M matrix with each entry equal to 0 or 1. We can find some rectangles in the matrix whose entries are all 1, and we define the maximum area of such rectangle as this matrix’s goodness.

We can swap any two columns any times, and we are to make the goodness of the matrix as large as possible.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: There are several test cases in the input. The first line of each test case contains two integers N and M (1 ≤ N,M ≤ 1000). Then N lines follow, each contains M numbers (0 or 1), indicating the N * M matrix

statement.title: Output
statement.content: Output one line for each test case, indicating the maximum possible goodness.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
4
2

Note: Huge Input, scanf() is recommended.

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2009 Multi-University Training Contest 2 - Host by TJU
